abstracts.cdata!:
Before a loan will be approved under the
            Private Industry Recovery Project for Albania, it must be
            verified that the enterprise has valid municipal, city,
            canton, or state licenses to operate including the
            environmental license, and that the operations, respecting
            the nominated exports, will be in accord with the applicable
            environmental law and standards of Albania and the
            guidelines for environmental assessment listed in this
            report. A visual inspection of the premises will be
            undertaken to verify that there are no hazardous activities
            being conducted. Questions that should be answered by the
            Albanian enterprise during the application process include
            the following: Indicate that the enterprise has a specific
            inventory of the type and volume of wastes that are, or will
            be generated by the project. Specify how each type of waste
            identified will be disposed of and/or treated. Identify the
            use of any special technological or managmeent approaches to
            minimize or recycle waste or minimize emissions. Indicate
            the nature of the impacts on the natural environment, e.g.,
            water, soil, flora, and fauna. Types of projects
            unacceptable on ecological grounds will include producing
            lead-based paint; trading in wildlife or wildlife products
            prohibited under the CITES (Convention on Trade in
            Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora); introducing
            genetically altered organisms; producing, distributing, and
            selling illegal pesticides; and using drift nest in fishing.
